item.title: Is Your Car Spying on You? What It Means That Tesla Shared Data in the Las Vegas Explosion
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Many cars know where youâ€™ve been and where you are going, and also often have access to your contacts, call logs, texts and other sensitive information thanks to cell phone syncing.

The post Is Your Car Spying on You? What It Means That Tesla Shared Data in the Las Vegas Explosion appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 6, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 6, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: US Sanctions Chinese Firm Linked to Flax Typhoon Attacks on Critical Infrastructure
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The US Treasury has sanctioned Chinese company Integrity Technology for supporting state-sponsored group Flax Typhoon in hacking US critical infrastructure.

The post US Sanctions Chinese Firm Linked to Flax Typhoon Attacks on Critical Infrastructure appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: IT Giant Atos Responds to Ransomware Group’s Data Theft Claims
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
IT services giant Atos has responded to the data breach claims made by a ransomware group named Space Bears.

The post IT Giant Atos Responds to Ransomware Group’s Data Theft Claims appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Tenable CEO Amit Yoran Dead at 54
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Tenable CEO and cybersecurity industry veteran Amit Yoran has passed away at the age of 54 after a battle with cancer.

The post Tenable CEO Amit Yoran Dead at 54 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: In Other News: Volkswagen Data Leak, DoubleClickjacking, China Denies Hacking US Treasury
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: location data of 800,000 electric Volkswagen cars leaked, DoubleClickjacking attack, China denies hacking US Treasury.

The post In Other News: Volkswagen Data Leak, DoubleClickjacking, China Denies Hacking US Treasury appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: FireScam Android Malware Packs Infostealer, Spyware Capabilities
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
The FireScam Android infostealer monitors app notifications and harvests credentials and financial data and sends it to a Firebase database.

The post FireScam Android Malware Packs Infostealer, Spyware Capabilities appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Exploit Code Published for Potentially Dangerous Windows LDAP Vulnerability
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Proof-of-concept (PoC) code was published for CVE-2024-49113, a denial-of-service (DoS) vulnerability in Windows LDAP.

The post Exploit Code Published for Potentially Dangerous Windows LDAP Vulnerability appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: US Imposes Sanctions on Russian and Iranian Groups Over Disinformation Targeting American Voters
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
The United States has imposed sanctions on two groups linked to Iranian and Russian efforts to target American voters with disinformation ahead of this yearâ€™s election.

The post US Imposes Sanctions on Russian and Iranian Groups Over Disinformation Targeting American Voters appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: New York Hospital Says Ransomware Attack Data Breach Impacts 670,000
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
Richmond University Medical Center has been investigating a ransomware attack since May 2023 and it recently determined that it affects 670,000 people.Â 

The post New York Hospital Says Ransomware Attack Data Breach Impacts 670,000 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Apple to Pay $95 Million to Settle Lawsuit Accusing Siri of Eavesdropping
item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.description:
Apple isnâ€™t acknowledging any wrongdoing in the settlement, which must be approved by a Judge and represents a sliver of the $705 billion in profits that Apple has pocketed since September 2014.

The post Apple to Pay $95 Million to Settle Lawsuit Accusing Siri of Eavesdropping appeared first on SecurityWeek.
